title: Report: Kaepernick's confidence shot; QB 'on an island' in 49ers locker room
text:
When the 49ers got rid of Jim Harbaugh after the 2014 season, they didn't just get rid of Harbaugh, they also got rid of Colin Kaepernick 's biggest supporter, which is bad news for the 49ers because apparently, Kaepernick could really use some support right now. 
According to FoxSports.com , not only is Kaepernick's confidence "completely shot," but he's not really getting along with anyone in the 49ers locker room.
It's not that Kaepernick's teammates necessarily dislike him, the fractured relationship has more to do with the fact that Kaepernick is a loner, who's currently "on an island in the locker room" because he doesn't connect well with his teammates. 
Although Kaepernick's not necessarily hated by his teammates, he was the subject of a heated team meeting that recently took place in the 49ers locker room. According to CSN Bay Area , Kaepernick was called out by a teammate during a players-only meeting.
The discussion between Kaepernick and the unnamed teammate got heated, before the two eventually settled their differences a few days later. 
Even if Kaepernick doesn't have the support of everyone in the locker room, he does still have the support of coach Jim Tomsula. 
After Kaepernick went 13 of 24 for 124 yards in San Francisco's 20-3 loss to Seattle on Thursday, Tomsula was asked if Kaepernick would remain quarterback. 
"Yes. Colin is our quarterback. There's no controversies," Tomsula said. 
There's a good chance that Tomsula will be answering that question after every 49ers loss from now until the end of the season. 

Colin Kaepernick is having some confidence problems. (USATSI)
